alert.note: Alert for Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 6:40AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Patrick. * WHEN...Until noon EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated along the Smith River near Woolwine. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 633 AM EDT, Gauge reports indicate excessive rainfall has occurred across the northern part of Patrick County with up to 3 inches of rain near the Blue Ridge Parkway. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area, and near the headwaters of the Smith River. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen across the county. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Smith River, Ivy Creek, Upper Dan River. - Some locations that will experience minor flooding include... Stuart... Woolwine... Ararat... Buffalo Ridge... Patrick Springs... Rocky Knob Recreation Area... Critz... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
